unnormalised: Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) announced revisions to its timetable for select routes beginning 10/11/2024, citing increased passenger volume during peak hours. The Yellow Line, connecting Samaypur Badli to Huda City Centre, will see trains operating at intervals of 3 mins between 8:00 AM and 11:00 AM, and then again from 5:00 PM to 8:00 PM. This is a slight adjustment from the previous schedule of 3.5 mins during those times.
normalised: Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (D-M-R-C) announced revisions to its timetable for select routes beginning tenth november two thousand and twenty four, citing increased passenger volume during peak hours. The Yellow Line, connecting Samaypur Badli to Huda City Centre, will see trains operating at intervals of three minutes between eight A.M. and eleven A.M., and then again from five P.M. to eight P.M. This is a slight adjustment from the previous schedule of three point five minutes during those times.

unnormalised: The Blue Line, a major artery linking Dwarka Sector 21 to Noida Electronic City/Vaishali, will also have adjusted timings. During the morning rush, trains will run every 2 mins 45 secs between 9:30 AM and 10:30 AM. Evening service will see a reduced interval of 3 mins from 6:30 PM to 7:30 PM. DMRC officials indicated that these changes were based on detailed ridership analysis and aimed at reducing congestion.
normalised: The Blue Line, a major artery linking Dwarka Sector twenty one to Noida Electronic City or Vaishali, will also have adjusted timings. During the morning rush, trains will run every two minutes forty five seconds between nine thirty A.M. and ten thirty A.M. Evening service will see a reduced interval of three minutes from six thirty P.M. to seven thirty P.M. D-M-R-C officials indicated that these changes were based on detailed ridership analysis and aimed at reducing congestion.

unnormalised: Commuters using the Violet Line (Kashmere Gate to Raja Nahar Singh) can expect trains every 5 mins between 12:00 PM and 2:00 PM on weekdays. Weekend schedules remain unchanged. The Airport Express Line will maintain its current frequency of trains every 10 mins.
normalised: Commuters using the Violet Line (Kashmere Gate to Raja Nahar Singh) can expect trains every five minutes between twelve P.M. and two P.M. on weekdays. Weekend schedules remain unchanged. The Airport Express Line will maintain its current frequency of trains every ten minutes.

unnormalised: Passengers are advised to check the DMRC website or mobile app for the complete and updated timetable, effective from 10 Nov 2024. Any further modifications will be communicated via public announcements and social media channels at least 48 hrs in advance.
normalised: Passengers are advised to check the D-M-R-C website or mobile app for the complete and updated timetable, effective from tenth November two thousand and twenty four. Any further modifications will be communicated via public announcements and social media channels at least forty eight hours in advance.
